features.featureTitle: Refactor `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` to render exactly 3 major homepage sections in this order (and remove all other current homepage sections): (1) Hero + value + primary CTA (merged), (2) How Forge works (Accordion preferred), (3) Live marketplace preview + final CTA (merged).

Update the Hero section in `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` to follow the required hero rules: remove `min-h-screen`; use `py-16 md:py-20`; set hero container width to `max-w-5xl`; include Forge brand mark, a single H1 that contains an "agent marketplace / capability marketplace / autonomous AI agents" keyword concept, a one-line product definition, outcome-driven supporting copy, two primary CTAs ("Explore Agents" and "Enter Marketplace"), and secondary CTAs ("Build Agent" and "Start Building"); add a light trust/credibility signal within the hero (not as an extra large section).

Implement Section 2 as a compact "How Forge Works" accordion (mobile-first) with exactly the three required capability pillars: (1) Agent Discovery, (2) Workflow Orchestration, (3) Trust + Settlement. Apply layout rules: `max-w-4xl` and `py-14 md:py-16`. Ensure keyboard navigation and ARIA attributes are correct for the accordion triggers/content.

Implement Section 3 as a merged "Live marketplace" preview with contextual placeholder data (no backend dependency) plus a visually dominant final CTA. Apply layout rules: marketplace container `max-w-6xl` and spacing `py-14 md:py-16`. Include "live ecosystem" framing copy (production-ready autonomous capability economy tone) and a final dominant CTA with one of the required labels ("Enter Marketplace", "Start Using Forge", or "Launch Your Agent").

Apply global spacing/container rules across the homepage refactor: replace any `py-20 md:py-28` with `py-14 md:py-16` for non-hero sections; ensure hero uses `py-16 md:py-20`; use `max-w-5xl` for hero, `max-w-4xl` for the accordion content section, and `max-w-6xl` for the marketplace preview section.

Reduce homepage motion/observer cost by removing unnecessary `useSectionEntryMotion` usages and intersection-triggered animations for deleted sections; keep motion only for: hero entrance, capabilities/how-it-works reveal, and final CTA emphasis. Ensure the refactored homepage uses no more than 3 section-entry observers total and respects `prefers-reduced-motion`.

Ensure semantic structure, accessibility, and SEO safety on the refactored homepage: use `<main>` containing `<section>` elements; no duplicate H1; use meaningful headings (H2/H3) per section; add ARIA labels where needed on interactive CTAs/controls; maintain WCAG AA contrast for text and interactive elements.

Follow technical safety rule for imports in the homepage refactor: avoid non-guaranteed path aliases; use relative imports in `frontend/src/pages/ForgeHomePage.tsx` (including for shadcn accordion components) unless the projectâ€™s alias configuration is already confirmed working for Vite builds.
